items.title: Na 210 dagen kan rodelantaarndrager Fiorentina weer eens juichen in de Serie A
items.summary: Het is al maanden crisis bij Fiorentina, maar zondag gaf de verrassende hekkensluiter een teken van hoop. Na 210 dagen boekte de ploeg van Paolo Vanoli, bovendien voor het eerst dit seizoen, een overwinning tegen Udinese. Is het lek dan nu toch eindelijk boven?

items.title: 'Haller-gevalletje' bij Mali roept woede op: 'Met dank aan de FIFA'
items.summary: Bij Mali was er groot chagrijn na de openingswedstrijd in de Afrika Cup. In Groep A was het land hard op weg naar een zege, maar in blessuretijd kwam Zambia nog langszij. Bondscoach Tom Saintfiet sneerde na afloop naar de FIFA.

items.title: Sources: Man Utd delay Zirkzee exit decision
items.summary: Manchester United are set to delay any decision on Joshua Zirkzee's future until later in the January window, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Slot decries 'reckless' Van de Ven tackle on Isak
items.summary: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has described the challenge from Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven which broke Alexander Isak's leg as "reckless."

items.title: Liverpool's Isak out for 'couple months' - Slot
items.summary: Arne Slot said he expects striker Alexander Isak to be sidelined for "a couple of months" after sustaining a broken leg in Liverpool's win over Tottenham.

items.title: Zicht op Liverpool-rentree Gakpo, Slot hoopt nog op Isak
items.summary: Cody Gakpo zou komend weekend zijn rentree kunnen maken bij Liverpool. Zijn manager Arne Slot noemt de kans fifty-fify. Verder heeft Slot de hoop dat het seizoen voor Isak nog niet voorbij is.

items.title: 'Milan verscheurt contract Origi (30) anderhalf jaar na laatste profduel'
items.summary: AC Milan neemt per direct afscheid van Divock Origi. De dertigjarige Belg had nog een contract tot het einde van dit seizoen, maar dat is nu in onderling overleg ontbonden, melden diverse Italiaanse media. Origi heeft al anderhalf jaar geen profduel meer gespeeld, maar deed onlangs nog wel mee bij de B-ploeg van Milan.

items.title: Isak facing two months out after 'reckless' tackle - Slot
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says Alexander Isak faces "a couple of months" out injured after a "reckless" challenge by Tottenham defender Micky van de Ven.

items.title: Infantino gets his way but countries fear Afcon switch will hit them in the pocket | Ed Aarons
items.summary: Political backbiting has led to accusations Fifa is running the show as tournament switches to four-year cycle It was a decision that took many by surprise, although not those who have been watching closely since February 2020. Members of the Confederation of African Football‚Äôs (Caf) executive committee, along with various other dignitaries including George Weah, the former Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner and president of Liberia at the time, were assembled in Rabat at a seminar to hear Gianni Infantino outline his plan for the development of competitions and infrastructure in African football. As well as improving standards in refereeing and mobilising investment in the continent‚Äôs infrastructure, the president of Fifa floated the prospect of holding its most important tournament, the Africa Cup of Nations, every four years instead of every two and described the current arrangement as ‚Äúuseless‚Äù. The argument ran that it would be more beneficial for countries ‚Äúat the commercial level‚Äù and would help to ‚Äúproject African football to the top of the world‚Äù. ‚ÄúLet us show the world what we can do,‚Äù added Infantino. ‚ÄúThis day is special ‚Äì it‚Äôs the start of a new chapter for African football.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Zvonimir Boban: ‚ÄòIf I didn‚Äôt do this it would be a betrayal of every value I have lived for‚Äô
items.summary: The Croatia legend on his return to Dinamo Zagreb, his fall out with Uefa and the ‚Äòshameful‚Äô actions of Gianni Infantino An afternoon mist is descending over Maksimir Stadion, enhancing the severity of its dramatic, precipitous angles. In a building across the way, Zvonimir Boban is explaining what brought him back. We are eating squid ink risotto in one corner of a room now configured as Dinamo Zagreb‚Äôs canteen; diagonally opposite is the spot where, fighting through the club‚Äôs youth system, a young arrival from Dalmatia used to sleep. ‚ÄúEmotionally it‚Äôs the biggest story of my life, this one,‚Äù Boban says, memories of this former dormitory leaping into his mind‚Äôs eye. ‚ÄúWhere, if not here?‚Äù He has, in some shape or form, been almost everywhere else. Boban has burned brightly but briefly in each of his various lives as a football administrator. The sport would look different were it not for his influence in senior roles at Fifa and Uefa across the past decade. Almost two years have passed since his high-profile resignation from the latter and there was always the sense Boban, opinionated and deeply principled, had further rungs to climb. Continue reading...

items.title: Key backs McCullum, Stokes to spearhead England's post-Ashes recovery
items.summary: Rob Key insists Brendon McCullum is the best man to continue leading England but admits he does not know what the ECB have planned in the wake of their abject Ashes defeat.
